column4: Hi, everyone.  I'm having a weird problem.  I'm getting a "cannot directory: no such file or directory" when I try to run the mkdir command.  Why would it say "no such file or directory"?  I *know* there's no such directory.  That's why I'm trying to create it...
try with -p flag
craigbass1976,:  Yes.  I'm running the command w/ sudo.  And -p doesn't seem to help.
could you pastebin the command with the result?
This all started because I was trying to install the gspca driver, but I'm not having any luck.  I can't get it to build.
ok, kjele
http://pastebin.com/eqKUGiGR
is that module folder read only?
It looks like that folder is locked for normal creation
Shouldn't I be able to write in there in sudo mode, though?
That folder is used by the kernel to write stuff to it. Even if you create a new folde it will be deleted.

Okay, thanks. :)  I guess that leads to my next problem.  I can't build the gspca driver for some reason.  I just want to be able to use my QuickCam E2500.  I was able to use it before, but I had to reinstall Ubuntu.
Where can I get a copy of that driver and what error message when you compile it?
Here's the link I wget'ed from:  http://mxhaard.free.fr/spca50x/Download/gspcav1-20071224.tar.gz
And what error you get?
http://pastebin.com/qA2DVpf1
It looks like it's looking for asm/semaphore.h, whatever that is.
gonna see if I can compile
Ok, thanks, kjele. :)
If you read the READ_AND_INSTALL file the kernel that is supported is from 2.6.11 so there are some files that are missing. Which is what you see.
Okay, thanks.  Dammit.  Sorry. :(
